column3: Growing up in New York with artist parents - a very liberal environment, where we were always encouraged to challenge the status quo - I think for a long time I confused jingoism with patriotism. And that is a mistake.
Growing up in New York City, I was always encouraged to question authority, and I think I confused patriotism with jingoism.
True patriotism is better than the wrong kind of piety.
